title: Reply to a mention in comments

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Access token authorized by TikTok Business Accounts. To obtain an access token, use /tt_user/oauth2/token/ .

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed format: application/json .

parameters.name: business_id
parameters.description: Application specific unique identifier for the TikTok Business Account. You can get the ID through the open_id field returned by /tt_user/oauth2/token/ .

parameters.name: video_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the video on which you want to create a reply. You can get the video_id from the item_id field returned by /business/mention/comment/list/ .

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the comment to which you want to create a reply. You can get the comment_id from the comment_id field returned by /business/mention/comment/list/ .

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text content of the reply you want to create. Length limit: 150 characters (UTF-8 encoding). Example: This is a comment #comment ðŸ™‚ .

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix-Return Code .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: request_id
top_fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.

fields.name: comment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the newly created reply. Example: 6990565363377392901 .

fields.name: parent_comment_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the comment to which the reply was created. Example: 6990565363377392901 .

fields.name: video_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the video where the reply was created. Example: 6990565363377392901 .

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Developer application and TikTok account scoped unique identifier for the user that made the reply. Example: ce9b7be629b0447af777a0ad9455783f61b7f790982b49fbda04a23b4722eaffe .

fields.name: create_time
fields.description: Unix/Epoch date-time when the reply was created, in UTC timezone. Example: 1627617835.

fields.name: text
fields.description: Text content of the reply. Example: This is a comment #comment ðŸ™‚ .
